docs.snippet: Shane Mosley just can't win. He seemed well on the way to his first victory since July 2001 tonight and then the other guy appeared to quit. And he still couldn't win.    Mosley, in his first fight as a junior middleweight, banged heads several ti...
docs.lead_paragraph: Shane Mosley just can't win. He seemed well on the way to his first victory since July 2001 tonight and then the other guy appeared to quit. And he still couldn't win. Mosley, in his first fight as a junior middleweight, banged heads several times with Raul Marquez, a former 154-pound champion, who sustained deep cuts over both eyes. Referee Kenny Bayless, on the advice of the ringside physician Dr. William Berliner, halted the scheduled 12-round bout at 2 minutes 41 seconds of the third round.
docs.abstract: Bout between former welterweight champion Shane Mosley and former 154-pound champion Raul Marquez is ruled no contest when referee stops scheduled 12-round fight in third round because of deep cuts to Marquez's eyes; photo (M)

headline.main: Mosley Can Only Muster No Contest

docs.snippet: ART, they say, is not a race. But who said anything about art? Oscar season is here. The race is on, and movie critics must step aside to make room for tipsters, handicappers, inside dopesters -- or else try our hands at soothsaying.    Some thing...
docs.lead_paragraph: ART, they say, is not a race. But who said anything about art? Oscar season is here. The race is on, and movie critics must step aside to make room for tipsters, handicappers, inside dopesters -- or else try our hands at soothsaying. Some things are easy enough to predict. The Academy Award nominations will be announced on Tuesday morning. That is pretty much the extent of my own clairvoyance. By Tuesday afternoon, however, and with increasing frequency in the weeks leading up to the awards ceremony on March 23, people will buttonhole me in the elevator, in the laundry room, at the school bus stop and on the supermarket checkout line and ask, ''So, who's going to win the Oscar this year?''
docs.abstract: A O Scott predicts upcoming Oscar nominations in major categories; photo (M)

headline.main: As Requested, My Thoughts On the Oscars

headline.name: Wolfgang Puck's Crisp Potato Galette With Scrambled Eggs

docs.snippet: SOME of the governmental accolades sound intimidating. There's the medal for service to culture from Russia (for a production of Puccini's ''Turandot''). There's the title Chevalier des Arts et des Lettres from France. But the American stage direc...
docs.lead_paragraph: SOME of the governmental accolades sound intimidating. There's the medal for service to culture from Russia (for a production of Puccini's ''Turandot''). There's the title Chevalier des Arts et des Lettres from France. But the American stage director Francesca Zambello takes no very esoteric view of what she does. ''I'm a populist, an opera evangelist,'' she says. ''I believe in making shows that speak to a broad audience. I'm not afraid of the word 'entertainment.' ''
docs.abstract: Article traces career of Francesca Zambello, who has directed everything from live adaptation of animated Disney film to current project--Hector Berlioz opera Les Troyens at Metropolitan Opera; critical response to Zambello's productions is often extreme; photos (L)

docs.snippet: Three young girls and an elderly woman died yesterday morning when they were trapped by flames and smoke in two unrelated fires in Suffolk County, the authorities said.    The first fire broke out about 5:30 a.m. in a two-story house in East Patch...
docs.lead_paragraph: Three young girls and an elderly woman died yesterday morning when they were trapped by flames and smoke in two unrelated fires in Suffolk County, the authorities said. The first fire broke out about 5:30 a.m. in a two-story house in East Patchogue, a spokesman for the Suffolk County Police Department said. The flames trapped two girls, identified as Rachael Broadman, 3, and Sydney Broadman, 2, in an upstairs bedroom of the house, at 121 Camille Lane, the police said.
docs.abstract: Fire in East Patchogue, NY, claims lives of toddlers Rachael and Sydney Broadman; Delia Espinoza and her granddaughter Ashley Rivadeneira die in unrelated fire in Bay Shore; photos (M)

headline.main: Fires on L. I. Kill 3 Children And a Woman

docs.snippet: DESPITE a difficult economic environment for many arts organizations, the Director's View Film Festival is offering an ambitious new documentary program this week in addition to its full schedule of film screenings, awards, panel discussions, rece...
docs.lead_paragraph: DESPITE a difficult economic environment for many arts organizations, the Director's View Film Festival is offering an ambitious new documentary program this week in addition to its full schedule of film screenings, awards, panel discussions, receptions and galas. Founded in 1999 by Robert Kesten, a former actor and documentary producer, the film festival honors and celebrates directors' contributions to filmmaking, while seeking to create a permanent film presence in the region through its program of screenings, conferences, seminars and educational programs in local schools.
docs.abstract: Article on Director's View Film Festival, founded in 1999 by former actor and documentary producer Robert Kesten, which is set to open in Connecticut; photos (M)

docs.snippet: Endings are always tough.    Tom Cruise spent hours with the legendary rock 'n' roll producer Phil Spector a few years ago, listening to stories about the old days and soaking up the Spector accent and body language. But when he and the writer and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Endings are always tough. Tom Cruise spent hours with the legendary rock 'n' roll producer Phil Spector a few years ago, listening to stories about the old days and soaking up the Spector accent and body language. But when he and the writer and director Cameron Crowe got down to work on a movie about Mr. Spector's life, they couldn't quite figure out how to bring the story to a satisfying conclusion.
docs.abstract: Article on prospects of making film about life and career of legendary rock 'n' roll producer Phil Spector, who has been arrested for murder of actress Lana Clarkson; photos (M)

headline.main: This Is Your Life, Phil Spector. Phil?

docs.snippet: A female nude stands in the middle of a 1929 collage by Magritte. She is framed, literally, by the faces of 16 men, each with his eyes closed. Written above and beneath her shapely body are the words: ''I do not see the woman hidden in the forest....
docs.lead_paragraph: A female nude stands in the middle of a 1929 collage by Magritte. She is framed, literally, by the faces of 16 men, each with his eyes closed. Written above and beneath her shapely body are the words: ''I do not see the woman hidden in the forest.'' This could be the visual epigraph for ''Talk to Her,'' Pedro Almodóvar's latest movie. Mr. Almodóvar won an Oscar in 2000 for ''All About My Mother.'' For ''Talk,'' he has already received the best director citation from the Los Angeles Film Critics Association, a Golden Globe for best foreign-language film and three European Film Awards.
docs.abstract: Margo Jefferson Revisions column discusses Pedro Almodovar's film Talk to Her, contending that metamorphosis is theme; photo (M)

headline.main: Suddenly Onscreen, It's All About Wonder
